Class ExpenseTracker

ExpenseTracker
public class ExpenseTracker extends Object

  • Constructor Details

    • ExpenseTracker

      public ExpenseTracker()

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Main file for the ExpenseTracker application. Initializes default categories and sample expenses, then demonstrates various expense analysis functionalities.
      Parameters:
      args - command line arguments

    • login

      public static boolean login(String email, String password)
      Authenticates a user with the provided email and password.
      Parameters:
      email - the user's email address
      password - the user's password
      Returns:
      true if authentication is successful, false otherwise

    • setBudget

      public static void setBudget()
      Guides the user through setting a new budget with amount, date range, and optional category. Creates a Budget object and adds it to the budgets collection. Displays a summary of the created budget.

    • getBudget

      public static Budget getBudget(int index)
      Retrieves a budget at the specified index.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the budget to retrieve
      Returns:
      the Budget object at the specified index, or null if index is invalid

    • recordExpense

      public static void recordExpense()
      Guides the user through recording a new expense. Supports both cash and digital expenses with bank transaction details. Creates an Expense object and adds it to the expenses collection. Displays a summary of the recorded expense.

    • computeDailyAve

      public static float computeDailyAve()
      Calculates the daily average of expenses.
      Returns:
      the average daily expense amount as a float

    • computeMonthlyAverage

      public static float computeMonthlyAverage()
      Calculates the monthly average of expenses.
      Returns:
      the average monthly expense amount as a float

    • viewMonthlyExpense

      public static void viewMonthlyExpense()
      Displays all monthly expenses with their totals and calculates the monthly average. Groups expenses by month and year, showing the total for each month.

    • viewDailyExpense

      public static void viewDailyExpense()
      Displays all daily expenses with their totals and calculates the daily average. Groups expenses by date, showing the total for each day.

    • viewTotalCategoryExpense

      public static void viewTotalCategoryExpense(String category)
      Displays expenses filtered by category and calculates the total for that category. If category is null, displays all uncategorized expenses.
      Parameters:
      category - the category to filter by, or null for uncategorized expenses

    • viewTotalExpense

      public static void viewTotalExpense()
      Displays all expenses recorded in the system with their individual details and calculates the grand total of all expenses.

    • viewCategoryExpensePercentage

      public static void viewCategoryExpensePercentage()
      Displays a percentage breakdown of expenses by category. Shows each category's total expense and its percentage of the overall spending, including uncategorized expenses.

    • generateID

      public static String generateID(String prefix, int idNum, int numOfDigits)
      Generates a unique ID with the specified prefix and numerical component.
      Parameters:
      prefix - the string prefix for the ID (e.g., "BUDG", "EXPN")
      idNum - the numerical component of the ID
      numOfDigits - the total number of digits for the numerical part (including leading zeros)
      Returns:
      the generated ID string

    • displayCategories

      public static void displayCategories()
      Displays all available expense categories to the user.

    • getDate

      public static DateTime getDate(String s)
      Prompts the user to enter date and time information and returns a DateTime object.
      Parameters:
      s - a string to customize the prompt (e.g., "Start", "End", or empty)
      Returns:
      a DateTime object constructed from user input

    • getCategory

      public static String getCategory()
      Prompts the user to select or create an expense category. Users can choose from existing categories, create a new one, or skip categorization.
      Returns:
      the selected or created category name, or null if no category was selected

    • getDailyExpenses

      public static ArrayList<Float> getDailyExpenses()
      Calculates total expenses for each day based on recorded expenses. Groups expenses by date and sums amounts for each unique date. The first element in the returned list is the total number of days.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of Float values where the first element is the number of days, followed by total expenses for each day

    • getMonthlyExpenses

      public static ArrayList<Float> getMonthlyExpenses()
      Calculates total expenses for each month based on recorded expenses. Groups expenses by month and year, summing amounts for each unique month. The first element in the returned list is the total number of months.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of Float values where the first element is the number of months, followed by total expenses for each month

    • getTotalCategoryExpense

      public static float getTotalCategoryExpense(String category)
      Calculates the total expense amount for a specific category.
      Parameters:
      category - the category to calculate total for, or null for uncategorized expenses
      Returns:
      the total expense amount for the specified category as a float

    • getTotalExpenses

      public static float getTotalExpenses()
      Calculates the total of all expenses recorded in the system.
      Returns:
      the grand total of all expenses as a float
